content.title: Radial Artery Anatomy
content.description: Lateral terminal branch of the brachial artery, running along the lateral aspect of forearm to wrist where it contributes to palmar arches.
content.origin: Brachial artery bifurcation in cubital fossa

course.forearm: Deep to brachioradialis, becomes superficial distally

relations.superficial_radial_nerve: Lateral to artery in middle forearm

clinical_applications.pulse_palpation: Easily felt at distal radius (standard pulse check)
clinical_applications.arterial_line: Common site for invasive BP monitoring
clinical_applications.coronary_bypass: Harvested as conduit (second choice after LIMA)
clinical_applications.transradial_access: Preferred site for coronary and peripheral intervention

content.allen_test: Assessment of dual hand circulation via radial and ulnar supply before radial artery harvest or access
content.statement: Radial Artery Anatomy is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Anatomy Upper-Extremity that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Radial Artery Anatomy helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Radial Artery Anatomy include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Radial Artery Anatomy.

definitions_glossary.concept: A fundamental idea or notion in the domain
definitions_glossary.property: A characteristic or attribute of an entity
definitions_glossary.relationship: A connection or association between concepts

sources.source: UpToDate. (2024). Radial Artery Anatomy. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
